title: Senior SAP Data Consultant
description:
Accenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services in strategy and consulting, interactive, technology and operations, with digital capabilities across all of these services. With our thought leadership and culture of innovation, we apply industry expertise, diverse skill sets and next-generation technology to each business challenge.
   

  

 We believe in inclusion and diversity and supporting the whole person. Our core values comprise of Stewardship, Best People, Client Value Creation, One Global Network, Respect for the Individual and Integrity. Year after year, Accenture is recognized worldwide not just for business performance but for inclusion and diversity too.
   

  

 “Across the globe, one thing is universally true of the people of Accenture: We care deeply about what we do and the impact we have with our clients and with the communities in which we work and live. It is personal to all of us.” –
 **Julie Sweet, Accenture CEO.**
**About our Nordic SAP Business Group:**
 Accenture and SAP have a longstanding relationship that extends more than 40 years. As the leading Nordic SAP transformation partner, we work with SAP end-to-end from product innovation to development and delivery. Together, we are revolutionizing the future of business through major SAP transformation programs with some of the biggest companies.
   

  

 Within our Nordic SAP community, we work with the newest SAP solutions and offerings such as SAP S/4 HANA Cloud, SAP CX, Ariba, SuccessFactors, SAP BTP and SAP RISE.
   

  

 We are now looking to expand our community at scale and are looking for candidates on several positions and seniority levels.
   

  

 To read more about our SAP Practice, visit us at https://www.accenture.com/us-en/services/sap-index
   

  

**SAP Data Nordic Value Tower:**
 Within the SAP Value Tower Data, we offer you the opportunity to work with SAP Data and to grow your knowledge within the area of Information Management, connected to SAP MDG, Master Data Management and Data Migration.
   

  

 We are looking for people who have a genuine interest in Data, want to grow and challenge themselves within that area and work with the best skilled colleagues.
   

  

**Role Overview:**
 As a junior SAP Data Consultant in Accenture’s Nordic SAP Business Group, you will be an integral part of our team supporting our clients SAP transformation projects through acting as a Functional Expert in the Data Migration and/or Data Governance areas. You will work closely with clients, translating their business and functional requirements into SAP design documents and overseeing solution delivery. Your strong business process knowledge, combined with your in-depth expertise will be key to designing effective and efficient solutions for our clients.
   

  

**Example project roles:**
- Advise clients on their data transformation strategies, driving value creation through the positioning of SAP enabled solutions as well as leading solutions from SAP partners and Accenture

- Be part of the data migration stream of an S/4HANA transformation, working with colleagues in delivery centers to execute on their data transformation and data upload strategies

- Work with clients on their transformational journey, by implementing Master Data Governance strategy and processes, following SAP best practices and Accenture’s proven ways of working

**What’s in it for you:**
- Help Accenture deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity

- Be part of our culture and core values in a truly human work environment

- Take part in our highly engaged and diverse global network, for collaboration and delivery

- Enjoy competitive compensation and benefits

- Develop your skills and build an extraordinary career

- Grab significant development and training opportunities to develop your business acumen, consulting toolbox, technical and professional skills

- Get internal coaching, support and guidance from a mentor, to progress in your work and professional career with continuous feedback

- Gain access to comprehensive tools and frameworks supported by our global organization, including implementation methodologies, knowledge databases, industry leading add-on software, expert networks and benchmarks

- Combine business consulting skills with technology strategy know-how

- Transform businesses with the newest technologies and making them data-driven companies

- Work with some of the biggest SAP clients in large global implementation projects

- Be an integral part of innovative SAP transformation projects

- Play a key role in transforming organizations and communities around the world.

**Qualifications**
**Must have:**
- Multiple years of hands-on experience with SAP Data Migration and/or Data Governance

- Multiple years of experience with team leadership and/or project management on S/4HANA or other SAP implementation or transformation projects

- Passion about SAP, innovation and delivery of the latest technologies to your clients

- Very good understanding of Master Data models, methods and standards

- Hands-on experience in working with SAP technologies within MDG, Data Quality, Data Management and/or Data Migration

- Experience of the full project lifecycle including estimating, planning and delivering a solution end-to-end

- Deep business & industry experience in one or more industries

- Strong resonance with Accenture’s values

- Motivation, persistence, eagerness to optimize and drive for excellence

- Strong analytical skills, result-oriented paired with highly structured working style and good sense of responsibility, flexibility and to be a team player

- Ability to effectively work with cross-functional teams/stakeholders in an international and fast-moving environment

- Excellent communication (verbal and written) and presentation skills to address technical and non-technical audiences in English

- A Bachelor or Master’s degree

**Very nice to have:**
- Nordic (Danish, Norwegian, Swedish or Finnish) language spoken

- An SAP certification in a relevant area

- Specific knowledge in a functional or business process area within SAP

- Deep skills in Data Transformation tools and activities

- Extensive experience with Data Quality and/or Data Cleansing tools and activities

 Locations
   

  

 Stockholm, Gothenburg, Malmö

title: Field Service Engineer - Sweden
description:
Join our team as a Field Service Engineer in a permanent role based in Sweden! The role is field-based and will mainly cover Sweden, Denmark, Finland and Norway. In this exciting position, you will be responsible for installing and upgrading systems and software at customer locations, ensuring that OIPT equipment is fully operational and ready for use. With regular extensive travel in the Nordic region and occasionally the EMEA area, this role offers the perfect opportunity for those who enjoy dynamic work environments and making a direct impact on customer satisfaction. Don't miss your chance to be part of our innovative team!

  

  

**Your Key Responsibilities would be:**


* To carry out the commissioning of equipment including any operational and maintenance training requirements
* Respond to emergency breakdowns for any warranty and service contract work.
* Report regularly to the EMEA Team Leader on all relevant issues and for PDR objectives.
* Provide a visit report for each customer visit, detailing work completed, outstanding issues, time spent on site, travelling etc., and help to ensure that all chargeable work is invoiced to the customer promptly.
* Authorise system ‘buy-off’ prior to shipment either with or in the absence of the customer.
* Liaise with technical support and systems engineering on any potential or actual system problems.
* Liaise with Sales Team to provide useful background information.
* Help to maintain an accurate record of the status of systems, timing of warranty, parts supplied and service contracts.
* Keep up to date all relevant enquiries and project files on any significant information.
* Provide detailed and accurate records of expenses incurred on behalf of the Company.

  




**You would be an ideal match if you have the following:**


* Formal Electronic qualification.
* Substantial relevant experience and training.
* Ability to interpret Electrical and Mechanical drawings
* Good PC / PLC experience preferred
* Experience in Semi-Conductor (desirable) or closely related high-tech electronic industry.
* Fluent English speaker, a second European language would be a plus.
* Driving licence.
* Be prepared for extensive travel for up to 90%.
* Able to work on own initiative & to prioritise multiple tasks.
* Clear & concise communicator.

  




At Oxford Instruments, we enable the world’s leading industrial companies and scientific research communities to image, analyse and manipulate materials down to the atomic and molecular level. At Plasma Technology, we provide tools for the engineering of micro- and nano-structures, with customers using our process solutions to research and produce materials and semiconductors vital for everything from medical devices and diagnostics, to electric cars and quantum computers.

  


**Benefits:**


* Company car
* Corporate Benefits
* Language Courses
* Flexible working hours
* Fantastic team and supportive culture
* Home office
* 26 days paid leave
* Great team events

  




To apply for this job, please, send us your CV and a covering letter in English outlining the relation of your experience to any project.

  


**Follow us at** www.twitter.com/oxinst or www.facebook.com/oxinst


#LI-Hybrid #LI-AL1

  


All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or disability. title: Research Engineering Lead
description:
**TL;DR**


We’re looking for a hands-on research and engineering leader to get the best performance out of commercial and open source frontier models, in order to power the future of AI software engineering. You’ll own experiments end-to-end—from dataset design to model alignment and performance optimization. Must be curious, experimental, and obsessed with squeezing the most out of models.

**Why Lovable?**

* **Change the world, literally:** 2025 is the year AI works, and Lovable has the best AI full stack engineer product (according to industry veterans)
* **Work, learn, have fun:** We’re building the strongest technical team in Europe. You will shape our culture and be inspired in a place of exceptional talent density
* **Build a unique network:** Lovable is a global top AI brand that the world is eager to work with. You will meet and work with some of the most important people in tech
* **Get autonomy & ownership:** With lots of things being built, this is a unique opportunity to get ownership and have a true impact on our product
* **Compensation:** Lovable pays top of market cash and equity, and is committed to compensate better than any other company in Sweden on a performance basis

**What we’re looking for**

* You’re a natural leader who is obsessed with building the best technical team in the world
* You’re a bold, unconventional thinker who learns at lightning speed
* You love working at the intersection of algorithms, data and machine learning
* You have a deep intuition for what works when training and fine-tuning LLMs
* You understand that synthetic data is the core of making the best AI systems during this decade, and are excited about generating data and increasing quality
* You know how to design high-quality and fast-paced experiments and have strong sense for effective evaluation
* You are relentless in debugging training runs just as much as designing new approaches
* You’ve got a pirate’s mindset: pragmatic, resourceful, and fast-moving

**Your day to day**


In one sentence: Create the most powerful ensemble of LLMs into lovable products.


You will:

* Identify and update the most important metrics to optimize from a product perspective
* Collaborate with fellow engineering leaders to build a world-class team of brilliant, ambitious people
* Design, run and analyze experiments grounded in real-world coding and product use cases
* Develop and maintain training pipelines, distillation workflows, and synthetic data generating systems
* Work closely with infra and product engineers to scale training efforts and ship results

**Our tech stack** We're pragmatic in picking the tools that make developers move as fast as possible, and have a platform team to support you.

**How applying works**

* Fill in a short form then jump on an initial exploratory call
* Complete a technical take-home exercise
* Dive deeper into your way of thinking over two technical interviews
* Join us for 1-2 days of trial work on-site if possible. We'll see how you tick and you get to meet the team and explore whether joining Lovable feels right for you

**About your application**

* Please submit your application in English. It’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join.
* We treat all candidates equally - if you are interested please apply through our application system.

title: Service Engineer- Brake

Link Engineering Company (LINK) is a premier designer and manufacturer of precision test equipment, we specialize in developing customized solutions for Automotive, Aviation, Off-Highway, Rail and Civil Engineering industries. We are headquartered in Plymouth, Michigan, and maintain testing laboratories, manufacturing, and support facilities around the globe.
Established in 1935, we have been a family-owned company for generations, we treat our customers and employees as if they are part of our family. We set our employees up for success, as they are given constant opportunities to learn and develop new skills. As many of our team members have been with LINK for a generation or more, the LINK team is equipped with a wealth of knowledge, providing decades of hands-on experience and out-of-the-box thinking to OEMs and suppliers everywhere.  

  

We are looking for a Service Engineer/Technicianresponsible for the activities related to Field Service ( Repair,Software Support, Calibration and Preventive Maintenance), Parts ( Sales and Repair) and Equipment Commissioning for our customers based in Europe.

* Independent commissioning, maintenance and calibration of brake testers and other test bench systems
* Fault analyses and repairs of all LINK systems and devices
* Support in the further development of our products through experience reports to product and service management


**PROFIL**
* Technician/master craftsman, engineering degree specializing in electrical engineering/mechatronics/mechanical engineering;
* Experience in calibration (Decelerometer, Accelerometer, Vmax Data Logger, Humidity sensors)
* Preferred previous experience in commissioning, maintenance, and repair of equipment test machine
* Knowledge of mechanical, hydraulic, electrical and software components
* Knowledge of MS Office

**Soft skills**

**WE OFFER**
* Career prospects in an international and dynamic company with a well-known tradition of quality and competence

* Professional and economic growth combined with acquired skills
* Technical training
* Good working atmosphere
* Attractive salary with flexible working hours and high job security
* Permanent employment contract

description:
****Vill du arbeta i ett fantastiskt team som möjliggör att våra kunder får den bästa digitala upplevelsen när de ska boka och åka på resor!****

 Vi söker en fullstackutvecklare till vårt Content-team. Teamet har idag backendansvar för att bygga högpresterande APIer som levererar innehåll till alla delar av verksamheten. Teamet utvecklar även verktyg för att verksamheten ska kunna hantera content enkelt och effektivt. Vi har ambitionen att ligga i framkant och jobba med modern teknik. I backendområdet betyder det att vi utforskar nya databassystem och i frontend jobbar vi med AI för att skapa effektiva verktyg.
   

  

 Teamen ansvarar för hela kedjan från kravförståelse, utveckling, deploy till förvaltning och support. Vi jobbar agilt med continuous delivery. I teamet arbetar vi idag med en del par-/mobbprogrammering och nära verksamheten med snabba feedbackloppar för ständig förbättring.
   

  

 Vi är 13 utvecklingsteam på vår IT-avdelning och vi utvecklar våra system i Microsoft miljö med moderna tekniker, ramverk och verktyg såsom .NET Core, C#, Node, Azure, React, JavaScript, Typescript, MS-SQL, Redis, MongoDB, etc.

 Till Ving söker vi nu en nyfiken, engagerad och fullstackutvecklare.
